descriptionNullable:
Imagine you work in a large footwear company named Footsy that has many offline stores across the globe.. Footsy sells footwear under 2 brand names - “Apex Grip” and “Elegant Glide”. Apex Grip is the brand name under which they sell shoes for men and Elegant Glide is the brand name under which they sell shoes for women.

Since beginning, Footsy factories across the globe used to segregate the shoes for Men and Women manually before handing it to the distributors who take these shoes respectively to the stores selling Apex Grip and Elegant Glide shoes.

The past 2 years have been good for Footsy and the demand for their products have increased four fold. But, with this growth in the business, it has become inefficient and difficult to separate footwear based on gender manually leading to incorrect segregations. This has led to several complaints from the distributors of Footsy.

To tackle this problem, you decide to create your own image classification model that can easily identify and label the shoes for “Men” and “Women”. For this, you first clicked and collected 811 images of the show in the “Men” category and 769 in the “Women” category.

Prepare an image classification model in Orange to detect whether the shoe is for Men or Women.
title: Gender Based on Shoe Images
subtitle: Gender Based on Shoe Images
description:
Imagine you work in a large footwear company named Footsy that has many offline stores across the globe.. Footsy sells footwear under 2 brand names - “Apex Grip” and “Elegant Glide”. Apex Grip is the brand name under which they sell shoes for men and Elegant Glide is the brand name under which they sell shoes for women.

Since beginning, Footsy factories across the globe used to segregate the shoes for Men and Women manually before handing it to the distributors who take these shoes respectively to the stores selling Apex Grip and Elegant Glide shoes.

The past 2 years have been good for Footsy and the demand for their products have increased four fold. But, with this growth in the business, it has become inefficient and difficult to separate footwear based on gender manually leading to incorrect segregations. This has led to several complaints from the distributors of Footsy.

To tackle this problem, you decide to create your own image classification model that can easily identify and label the shoes for “Men” and “Women”. For this, you first clicked and collected 811 images of the show in the “Men” category and 769 in the “Women” category.

Prepare an image classification model in Orange to detect whether the shoe is for Men or Women.
